Package Util

Class AABB

java.lang.Object
Util.AABB
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractActor
public class AABB extends Object
Axis-aligned bounding box (AABB) class In this game, it stores the Actor position and the size of the actor as well. Spire class also uses this to render a sprite (an image) to the screen.

  • Constructor Details

    • AABB

      public AABB(Position2D<Float> pos, float szX, float szY)
      Constructor, directly sets the every parameter
      Parameters:
      pos - "top right" (wrt. the screen coordinates) of the box
      szX - horizontal size of the box in pixels
      szY - vertical size of the box in pixels

  • Method Details

    • collides

      public boolean collides(AABB other)
      Checks collision between two AABBs, returns true if two aabbs collide (intersects) with each other.
      Parameters:
      other - other aabb that will be checked with this one

    • moveIfCollide

      public boolean moveIfCollide(AABB other)
      Moves this AABB to the nearest valid location, if two aabbs collide (intersects). Does not touch the other aabb. Usefull for checking moving objects with static objects, (ie. player vs. walls)
      Parameters:
      other - other aabb that will be checked with this one

    • shrink

      public void shrink(float percentageX, float percentageY)
      Shrinks the aabb from the center, with different dimensions
      Parameters:
      percentageX - should be between (0, 1.0], 1.0 means no shrink
      percentageY - should be between (0, 1.0], 1.0 means no shrink

    • shrink

      public void shrink(float percentage)
      Shrinks the aabb from the center
      Parameters:
      percentage - should be between (0, 1.0], 1.0 means no shrink
